results.title: Grandeur and obedience; The Light of experience
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Michael Gill and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 7 and 8 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 7. Sir Kenneth Clarke presents Rome of the Counter-revolution - the Rome of Michelangelo and of Bernini. The Catholic Church in its fight against the Protestant North developed a new splendour symbolised by the glory of St. Peter’s. Part 8. The telescope and the microscope revealed new worlds in space and in a drop of water. The realism of Dutch painting took the observation of human character a stage further.

results.title: The Hero as an artist; Protest and communication
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Michael Gill and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 5 and 6 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 5. Michelangelo, Raphael and Leonardo da Vinci are featured in this program which centres on Papal Rome in the early 16th century. Sir Kenneth Clarke’s theme takes him through the gardens and courtyards of the Vatican to the rooms decorated for the Pope by Raphael and to the Sistine Chapel. Part 6. The theme of protest and communication leads Sir Kenneth to the Reformation, the Germany of Albrecht Durer and Martin Luther, to Erasmus, the France of Montaigne and to the Elizabethan England of Shakespeare.

results.title: The AIF's Great Route March : Review No 460
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
This Cinesound newsreel consists of footage of the AIF’s Great Route March - a training march across the Blue Mountains to Bathurst which took twelve days over one hundred and thirty miles.

results.title: Kokoda front line!
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly news magazine (No. 568) produced by Cinesound in Sydney. This edition consists of one ‘fullreel’ item - “Kokoda Front Line” - by Damien Parer about the war in New Guinea. Includes a discussion on jungle warfare and the servicing of Australian troops on the front line. Winner of an Academy Award in 1942. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: R.A.N. ashore and afloat: it's the navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
Special 1000th issue of Cinesound Review devoted to the Royal Australian Navy; the Senior Service. Class room training and recruitment is put to good use aboard the H.M.A.S. Latrobe. Photography by Geoffrey Thompson.

results.title: Drought grips Riverina
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
An edition of the weekly Cinesound newsreel (Ep. 679) consisting of one “full-reel” item: “Drought grips Riverina”, alerting the public to the severity of the drought, and criticising the destructive abuse of the land by farmers who overstock. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
